WRITING.TEXT: For me she represented someone who could kick ass, and look good while doing it. It was breathtaking watching her in Star Wars, and then all these years with her acting, her writing, and her biting wit. We are very worse without her. I feel super bad for those that knew her personally, and especially for her family. No parent should outlive their child. She truly was Hollywood royalty. A bit more of my childhood died this week.
I know, but for some reason this one hurts a lot more than the others this year.
Of all the deaths this year, this one hurts the most.

WRITING.TEXT: Sigh. Another hire me consultant saying he's got a plan. Can we fucking stop with this and just ENJOY Christmas?
You sound A LOT like a consultant and not someone who actually has to RIDE THE FUCKING TTC.

You're living up to your username. All I did was fill in a fucking survey. It's Christmas season. Believe in what you believe.
You're going on ignore.

You're missing my reply, but hey that's fine, believe what you want. All levels of government should be properly funding transit. Period.
Saying the province is passing the buck is unacceptable in my eyes, and I'm glad I didn't vote for her in the last election. I'm not barking up the wrong tree, and I answered your question.
I'm just sharing the bullshit she emailed back at me. Heaven forbid the feds take ANY leadership on this.

I sent an email to all three levels of government, and was incredibly disappointed by the response by the Federal one. The email was asking for PROPER funding to bring us up to the rest of the world basically. We're so comically underfunded it's ridiculous. Here's her response:
"Thank you for reaching out. I appreciate that you took the time to write to me concerning funding for the TTC.
As you may know, our budget which was tabled in March allocated $3.4 billion to public transit over 3 years. Almost $1.5 billion of this will go to Ontario which is the largest investment in public transit by the federal government to date. In fact, the Prime Minister was at Greenwood Yard earlier this year to announce that the federal government would invest $840 million in the TTC.
While the federal government is a committed partner to provincial and municipal governments, we are not the decision makers in regard to operations or the provision of services.
Yours truly,
Julie"

WRITING.TEXT:
If they honestly did a survey of the bar staff and a vast majority said hell yes, bring it on, I'd be for it.
I worked in the service industry for years and still work in it, though not in the bar side anymore...
There comes a point when you just want to GO HOME and stop caring about people.

I love how everyone expects that bardenders and bouncers and servers don't want to have fucking lives. Sure we'd all like extra money, but those that work in the service industry want some fucking time away from work.
Otherwise we're no better than the robots on Westworld.

I love how everyone expects that bardenders and bouncers and servers don't want to have fucking lives. Sure we'd all like extra money, but those that work in the service industry want some fucking time away from work.
Otherwise we're no better than the robots on Westworld.

The majority of workers would like to go home and get some sleep before they have school. And as noted in the top comment, how much more money would be required to keep the subway running longer, or have more bus service? It's an idea that requires further study, not just a knee jerk reaction.
